an5.63:1.1: “Mendicants, a male noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
an5.63:1.3: He grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an5.63:1.4: A male noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
an5.63:2.1: He who grows in faith and ethics,
an5.63:2.2: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—
an5.63:2.3: a good man such as he sees clearly,
an5.63:2.4: and takes on what is essential for himself in this life.”
